description: The town where Gol D. Roger was born and executed, known as the 'Town of the Beginning and the End.' The last stop before entering the Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Mysterious Storm Descends on Loguetown
keyEvents.description: An unnatural storm rapidly descends upon Loguetown, with atmospheric pressure dropping at an impossible rate.
keyEvents.significance: The mysterious timing of the storm, arriving precisely when Luffy needs to escape, raises questions about Dragon's potential weather-controlling abilities.

keyEvents.title: Green Wind Phenomenon
keyEvents.description: An unnatural green gust of wind sweeps through Loguetown, helping with the escape of both the Straw Hats and the captured Buggy and Alvida.
keyEvents.significance: This mysterious green wind is suspected to be connected to Dragon's powers, becoming a significant clue about his abilities.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Depart Loguetown
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully escape Loguetown and set sail toward the Grand Line.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Loguetown Arc and the crew's final moments in the East Blue.

description: The streets of Loguetown where many battles and encounters take place during the Straw Hats' escape.

keyEvents.title: Zoro vs Tashigi Battle
keyEvents.description: Tashigi confronts and duels Zoro in the streets of Loguetown.
keyEvents.significance: Site of the battle that continues to establish the Zoro-Tashigi rivalry.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs Smoker Confrontation
keyEvents.description: Smoker catches up to Luffy in the streets and they engage in battle.
keyEvents.significance: Site of the first major confrontation between Luffy and Smoker.

keyEvents.title: Dragon's Intervention
keyEvents.description: Dragon appears in the streets to stop Smoker from capturing Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Dragon makes his first major intervention, changing the course of events.

description: The harbor area of Loguetown where ships dock and depart for the Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Smoker Captures Pirates at the Docks
keyEvents.description: Smoker uses his White Out technique to trap Buggy, Alvida, and their crews at the docks.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Smoker's effectiveness at protecting Loguetown from pirates attempting to enter the Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Boards the Going Merry
keyEvents.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Rocket from the docks to board the Going Merry with his crewmates.
keyEvents.significance: The docks serve as the launching point for the Straw Hats' escape to the Grand Line.

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel given to them by Kaya. Features a sheep figurehead.

keyEvents.title: Crew Boards via Gomu Gomu no Rocket
keyEvents.description: Luffy uses his stretching powers to propel himself and his crewmates onto the Going Merry.
keyEvents.significance: The ship serves as the escape vehicle and site of the iconic vow ceremony.

keyEvents.title: Grand Line Vow Ceremony
keyEvents.description: On the deck of the Going Merry, the Straw Hat crew performs the iconic barrel ceremony where each member declares their dream.
keyEvents.significance: One of the most iconic locations for one of the most memorable scenes in One Piece, solidifying the crew's bonds as they enter the Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Approaching the Grand Line
keyEvents.description: The Going Merry sails toward the entrance to the Grand Line.
keyEvents.significance: The ship carries the crew from the East Blue to the Grand Line, marking a major transition in the series.

name.japanese: 東の海（イーストブルー）

description: One of the four Blues, known as the weakest sea. The sea where Luffy began his journey.

keyEvents.title: Departing the East Blue
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats leave the East Blue and head toward the Grand Line entrance.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the end of the East Blue Saga, concluding the crew's adventures in their home sea.

statusHistory.reason: The East Blue remains as it is
